title: How many staff report working extra hours?
analysis_commentary:
One way in work pressures may manifest itself is staff working extra hours (more than 5 hours per week) than they are contracted to do so (either paid or unpaid).

Between 2003 and 2006 a large proportion (over 70%) of NHS staff were reporting that they had worked extra hours. This then fell in 2007 and remained static around 65-66% until 2011. There was, however, a five percentage point increase in 2012, back up to the 70% mark, which has been sustained through 2013 and 2014.

Although responses from staff in ambulance trusts follow a similar trend over time they consistently report working extra hours more than staff in other trust types.
